title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: Mark this, ye polluters and defilers of pure streams. I have also fished for trout at Melville Castle, and, along with my father, chased many from stone to stone at Dalhousie  ; but l the place that once knew them, knows them no more.'

title: The Dew of Their Youth
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: "Willie's ga'en to Melville Castle,    Boots an' spurs an' a'--!"
